_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:57:46 using v2.1
title: How has the number of ambulance staff changed over time?
analysis_commentary: There is annual variation in the number of ambulance staff with a trough each summer followed by a rise as newly qualified staff join the workforce, reaching a peak in the winter. There has been an increase in the number of ambulance staff over the past five years, from an average of 17,551 in 2009-10 to 17,849 in 2013-14. That said, the number of ambulance staff in May 2014 (the latest month for which data is available) is less than at any point since January 2010.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
